meanings.definition: The act of regarding or representing something as perfect or better than in reality.
meanings.sent1: Her idealization of the new student made her believe he could do no wrong.
meanings.sent2: The idealization of celebrities in magazines can create unrealistic expectations.
meanings.sent3: His idealization of his cat as a superhero was both cute and funny.
meanings.sent4: The idealization of love in movies often leads to disappointment in real relationships.
meanings.sent5: The idealization of nature in his paintings made them truly breathtaking.

meanings.definition: The process of forming an ideal or perfect image of something.
meanings.sent1: The idealization of her dream house helped her stay motivated to save money.
meanings.sent2: In art class, they learned about the idealization of beauty in ancient sculptures.
meanings.sent3: His idealization of his favorite food as a magical potion was quite imaginative.
meanings.sent4: The idealization of success as a straight path often overlooks the struggles along the way.
meanings.sent5: The idealization of the past can sometimes prevent us from appreciating the present.
